messages.content: Should you wear a mask around other people when you're sick?

It's generally recommended to wear a mask when you're sick to protect others from your germs. However, it's also important to consider your own personal comfort and well-being. If you feel too sick to wear a mask, it's still recommended to practice good hygiene and to stay home to avoid spreading your illness to others.
What if I don't want to?

It is understandable that people may feel uncomfortable wearing a mask, especially if they have concerns about it being uncomfortable or causing them to feel like they are being watched. However, it is important to understand that wearing a mask can help protect others and reduce the risk of spreading COVID-19. If you feel that wearing a mask is necessary to protect yourself or others, it is important to do so because it is the right thing to do. It is also important to prioritize the health and safety of others over your own comfort. If you decide not to wear a mask, it is still important to practice good hygiene and to stay home to avoid spreading your illness to others.
